intro: Jacquemontia heterotricha, commonly known as the purpleleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to purple flowers that bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a distinctive purplish tinge, adding to its ornamental appeal. Jacquemontia heterotricha is typically found in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full sun.
